intro: Schlosseria heterophilla, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to the arid environments it inhabits. Schlosseria heterophilla is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
